IntegrationTests.Payments.helpers.android

Class AndroidSend_RequestMoneyHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • IntegrationTests.Payments.helpers.base.Send_RequestMoneyHelper
      • IntegrationTests.Payments.helpers.android.AndroidSend_RequestMoneyHelper

  • public class AndroidSend_RequestMoneyHelper
extends Send_RequestMoneyHelper
    contains all methods to verify different scenarios present on send/request money screen

      • check

        public long check(java.lang.String mobileNo,
                  java.lang.String emailID,
                  java.lang.String contact,
                  int amount,
                  java.lang.String comment,
                  java.lang.String otp,
                  java.lang.String walletBalance,
                  java.lang.String selfEmail_Mobile,
                  java.lang.String type,
                  java.lang.String build)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Method to verify the send/request money feature via email, contact list and mobile. In this, following scenarios have been covered: 1. Amount equal to Rs.0 2. Amount less than Rs.5 3. Amount between Rs. 5 and Rs. 10,000 4. Amount plus Wallet Balance greater than Rs.10000
        Parameters:
        mobileNo - - mobileNo on which the amount is to be sent
        emailID - - email id of the User
        contact - selected from my contact list
        amount - to be sent
        comment - entered
        otp - -query to fetch otp
        walletBalance - - Balance available in the wallet
        selfEmail_Mobile - - emailID and mobile number of the User
        type- - send/request
        build - - Environment is staging, beta or production
        Returns:
        Reference Id
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - When any exception comes
